content.raw: Can you explain at a high level why you need the new `HaptixGazeboJointHelper` class on top of `Gazebo::Joint` to calculate transmission?
content.html: Can you explain at a high level why you need the new HaptixGazeboJointHelper class on top of Gazebo::Joint to calculate transmission?

pullrequest.title: add one more layer for motor transmission

content.raw:
It contains a `gazebo::physics::JointPtr`, which either points to a real Gazebo Joint object, or is left NULL. When controller calls an equivalent Gazebo Joint API using HaptixGazeboJointHelper class, it either passes them through or get/store the temporary values for the non-existent joint.

A pesudo-code example below:
~~~
HaptixGazeboJointHelper realJoint;
realJoint.SetJoint(realGazeboJointPtr);
HaptixGazeboJointHelper noJoint;

realJoint.GetPosition(0);  // effectively calls realJoint->GetPosition(0) based on physic state

noJoint.SetPosition(10);  // sets noJoint.fakeJoint to 10
noJoint.GetPosition(0);  // returns noJoint.fakeJoint
~~~

The reason is that we created artificial motor joints which do not exist in the Gazebo model for the arm (`indexm`, `middlem`, `ringm` and `pinkym`), and we want to manipulate these *fake joints*, but in a transparent way as the real joints.
content.html:
It contains a gazebo::physics::JointPtr, which either points to a real Gazebo Joint object, or is left NULL. When controller calls an equivalent Gazebo Joint API using HaptixGazeboJointHelper class, it either passes them through or get/store the temporary values for the non-existent joint.

A pesudo-code example below:

HaptixGazeboJointHelper realJoint;
realJoint.SetJoint(realGazeboJointPtr);
HaptixGazeboJointHelper noJoint;

realJoint.GetPosition(0);  // effectively calls realJoint->GetPosition(0) based on physic state

noJoint.SetPosition(10);  // sets noJoint.fakeJoint to 10
noJoint.GetPosition(0);  // returns noJoint.fakeJoint

The reason is that we created artificial motor joints which do not exist in the Gazebo model for the arm (indexm, middlem, ringm and pinkym), and we want to manipulate these fake joints, but in a transparent way as the real joints.

content.raw:
Thanks a lot, that was helpful.

I think the next step is to transfer the new calculation of the motor data (`(offset + jointpos)*gear_ratio`) to the [HAPTIX API page](https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/haptix/api/0.2.2/index.html). This will need to be done in a haptix_comm PR.
content.html:
Thanks a lot, that was helpful.

I think the next step is to transfer the new calculation of the motor data ((offset + jointpos)*gear_ratio) to the HAPTIX API page. This will need to be done in a haptix_comm PR.
